translated:
Eländer, Olof Gustaf Elis, editor, Gothenburg, born July 10, 1884 in Käringön, Gothenburg and Bohus County. Firstborn son of bank manager and municipal chairman Olof E. and Betty Bengtsson. Married in 1909 to Hilma Janson, died in 1936. Children: Bertil, born in 1910, church administrator in Grästorp, and Gösta, born in 1912, law graduate and temporary assistant judge at the Gothenburg Municipal Court. 

Eländer was a student at the Gothenburg Commercial School from 1898-1900 and studied at the College of Business Administration at the Gothenburg University from 1915-1916. He travelled to Norway, Denmark and Finland, and worked as a substitute clerk at the Gothenburg Tax Office, clerk at the merchant office from 1900-1902, administrator at the Gothenburg Morning Post economic department from 1902-1907, secretary and financial manager of the Gothenburg Diocese newspaper and its publishing company from 1907-1917, chief accountant of AB Kattegats branch office in Stockholm from 1917-1918, editor-in-chief of the Borlänge newspaper from 1919-1927, and editor of the New Daily Allehanda in Gothenburg from 1927-1937. He was a contributor to several newspapers and magazines, and served on the board of directors of the Gothenburg Diocese newspaper and its publishing company from 1911-1917. 

He was a secretary of the Borlänge town council from 1919-1927, a member of the rent tribunal from 1919-1923, chairman of the road committee in Stora Tuna and Silvberg from 1923-1924, and chairman of the temperance society from 1923-1927. He was also chairman of the Swedish Red Cross in Gothenburg from 1921-1927, a member of the children's committee from 1924-1927, and a member of the board of the Swedish Youth Association in Gothenburg from 1905-1906 and 1909-1911. He was a member of the board of the Public Society and the Swedish Journalist Association, and belonged to the Freemasons and the Order of Odd Fellows. He was a recipient of the Swedish Red Cross's merit medal of the 2nd class.
